member.name: P:AbatabData.Core.Debuggler.DebugMode
member.summary: The debug mode that Abatab will use when executed.
member.remarks:
Setting Description
disabled Debugging functionality is disabled.
enabled Debugging functionality is enabled.
* Debug mode can have a significant impact on performance, and should not be enabled in production environments.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Core.Debuggler.DebugEventRoot
member.summary: The root directory where the Abatab debug logs are stored.
member.remarks: * At runtime the DebugEventRoot value is created as a sub-directory of the AbatabDataRoot.
member.example: * If AbatabDataRoot=C:\Abatab\LIVE, and DebugEventRoot=logs\debug, then DebugEventRoot would be set to C:\Abatab\LIVE\logs\debug at runtime.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Core.Logging.LoggingMode
member.summary: The logging mode that Abatab will use when executed.
member.remarks:
Setting Description
session Only session logs are created.
trace Only trace logs are created.
error Only error logs are created.
warning Only warning logs are created.
all All logs types are created.
warning Do not create any log files.
* To create multiple types of logs, separate each type with a hypen ("-").
member.examples: * To only create session logs: LoggingMode=session * To create session and trace logs: LoggingMode=session-trace * To create session, trace, and warning logs: LoggingMode=session-trace-warning

member.name: P:AbatabData.Core.Logging.Detail
member.summary: The detail level of log files (currently not used).

member.name: P:AbatabData.Core.Logging.EventErrorRoot
member.summary: The root directory where the Abatab error logs are stored.
member.remarks: * At runtime the EventErrorRoot value is created as a sub-directory of the AbatabDataRoot.
member.example: * If AbatabDataRoot=C:\Abatab\LIVE, and DebugEventRoot=logs\debug, then DebugEventRoot would be set to C:\Abatab\LIVE\logs\debug at runtime.

member.name: T:AbatabData.Module.Testing
member.summary: Defines the properties for the AbatabData.Module.Testing object, containing the information/data that Abatab needs to do its job.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Module.Testing.Mode
member.summary: The default behavior of the Abatab Testing Module. [more info]

member.name: T:AbatabData.Module.QuickMedOrder
member.summary: Defines the properties for the AbatabData.QuickMedOrderData object, containing the information needed for ModQuickMedOrder functionality.

member.name: T:AbatabData.Session
member.remarks:
Contains properties for the following:
Standard session properties
Debugging functionality
Logging functionality
OptionObjects
Modules

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabMode
member.summary: The mode that Abatab will use when executed.

item.description: All functionality is available, but no changes are made to Avatar.

list.item: If this is set to AbatabMode=enabled, you are still able to disable specific modules via their corresponding mode setting.
The AbatabMode=passthrough mode is intended for development, not production.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabRoot
member.summary: The root directory where the Abatab web service has been deployed.

list.item: At runtime the AvatarEnvironment value is added to the end of AbatabRoot to form the complete path.

member.example: If AbatabRoot=C:\Abatab_, and AvatarEnvironment=LIVE, then AbatabRoot would be set to C:\Abatab_LIVE at runtime.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabDataRoot
member.summary: The root directory where the Abatab data is stored.

list.item: At runtime the AvatarEnvironment value is created as a sub-directory of the AbatabDataRoot.
This is the directory where exported data/logs should be stored.

member.example: If AbatabDataRoot=C:\Abatab, and AvatarEnvironment=LIVE, then AbatabDataRoot would be set to C:\Abatab\LIVE at runtime.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AvatarEnvironment
member.summary: The Avatar environment that Abatab will reference when executed.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabFallbackUserName
member.remarks: * If sentOptObj.OptionUserId does not contain a valid username, AbatabFallbackUserName will be used.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabUserName
member.remarks: * This should be set to the value in sentOptObj.OptionUserId * If the value in sentOptObj.OptionUserId is not valid, this will be set to AbatabFallbackUserName.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.ScriptParameter
member.summary: The Script Parameter that Avatar sends to Abatab.
member.remarks: * Script Parameter syntax is MODULE-COMMAND-ACTION[-OPTION] * More information about the Script Parameter can be found here.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabModule
member.summary: The Module component of the Script Parameter.
member.remarks: * This is the first component of the Script Parameter.
member.example: * The Script Parameter QuickMedOrder-Dose-VerifyAmount uses the QuickMedOrder module.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabCommand
member.summary: The Command component of the Script Parameter.
member.remarks: * This is the second component of the Script Parameter.
member.example: * The Script Parameter QuickMedOrder-Dose-VerifyAmount contains the Dose command.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabAction
member.summary: The Action component of the Script Parameter.

list.item: This is the third component of the Script Parameter.

member.example: The Script Parameter QuickMedOrder-Dose-VerifyAmount contains the VerifyAmount action.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.AbatabOption
member.summary: The (optional) Option component of the Script Parameter.
member.remarks: * This is the fourth component of the Script Parameter. * This is an optional component.
member.example: * The Script Parameter QuickMedOrder-Dose-VerifyAmount-PrintToScreen contains the PrintToScreen action.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.SentOptObj
member.summary: The OptionObject that Avatar sends to Abatab.
member.remarks: * This OptionObject is not modified by Abatab. * More information about the OptionObjects can be found here.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.WorkOptObj
member.summary: The OptionObject that Abatab (potentially) modifies during a session.
member.remarks: * This OptionObject starts out as a copy of SentOptObj. * This OptionObject is potentially modified by Abatab. * More information about the OptionObjects can be found here.

member.name: P:AbatabData.Session.FinalOptObj
member.summary: The OptionObject that Abatab sends back to Avatar.
member.remarks: * This OptionObject is a copy of WorkOptObj. * More information about the OptionObjects can be found here.
